Internal auditing identifies problems, nonconformities and risks, as well as monitoring progress in closing previ- ously identified problems, nonconformities and risks. 4 Problems, nonconformities and risks identified are analysed comprehensively to determine weaknesses in the management system. Internal auditing focuses on the identification of good practices (which can be considered for use in other areas of the organization) as well as on improvement opportunities. 5 A process is established for the review of all internal audit reports to identify trends that can require organization-wide corrective actions or opportunities for improvement.
